item.title: Differences Between ERC 20 and ERC 721
item.description: To understand the differences betweenÂ ERC20Â andÂ ERC721, letâ€™s delve into their characteristics: Fungibility vs. Non-Fungibility: ERC20Â tokens areÂ fungible. This means that each token is identical and interchangeable with any other token of the same type. For example, if you have an ERC20 token representing a cryptocurrency, one unit of that token is equivalent to any other unit of the same token. ERC721Â tokens, on the other hand, areÂ non-fungible.
